content.description: Another good v2 in the North Forty.  Start as per Butt Cradle, and head straight up instead of left.
content.protection: Better landing then Butt Cradle, but a pad or two and spotter would be nice.
content.location: See description for Butt Cradle.  Mother In Law Boulder, Honeycomb boulder-like face, only triangular.

content.description: start matched in decent undercling make big move to sloper ledge bump or match your way out right and top out around the corner, fun but kind of lame finish
content.location: boulder behind honey comb just right of fiber con

content.description: Climbs jugs on the overhanging arete. Top out just left of the point.
content.location: Arete to the left of Butt Cradle, north most climb on the Toilet Bowlder.

content.description: fun boulder, starts seated with good undercling and left hand edge middle of the boulder, climb up to nifty pinch block and cruise through a chill but probably dirty top out

Butt Cradle isn't the most inspiring name, but the climb requires strength, technique, and some endurance. Start sitting in the toilet rim shaped rock, and make a traverse left until you hit the big crack.  Then finish up the crack.
content.protection: A couple of pads, and spot.  The top-out is insecure and over a couple of potential ankle breakers.
content.location: On the Mother In Law boulder.  Just around the corner from The Honeycomb boulder.  This wall is smaller, and triangle-shaped, but has a similar look to the Honeycomb boulder's main face.

content.description: Tilted boulder with some fun climbs, but weird top outs. There are climbs on both the west and south sides of this block.
